contentrichtext.text: {{taxobox |name = Snake's head restrepiella |image = Restrepiella ophiocephala.jpg |image_caption = Snake's head restrepiella<br>(''Restrepiella ophiocephala'') |regnum = [[Plantae]] |unranked_divisio = [[Angiosperms]] |unranked_classis = [[Monocots]] |ordo = [[Asparagales]] |familia = [[Orchidaceae]] |subfamilia = [[Epidendroideae]] |tribus = [[Epidendreae]] |subtribus = [[Pleurothallidinae]] |genus = '''''Restrepiella''''' |genus_authority = [[Leslie Andrew Garay|Garay]] & [[Dunst.]] |species = '''''R. ophiocephala''''' |binomial = ''Restrepiella ophiocephala'' |binomial_authority = ([[John Lindley|Lindl.]] (1838) [[Leslie Andrew Garay|Garay]] & [[Dunst.]] (1966) |}} The '''snake's head restrepiella''' (''Restrepiella ophiocephala'') is a [[species]] of [[orchid]] and the only species of the genus '''''Restrepiella'''''. The orchid is known from [[Mexico]] to [[Costa Rica]], occurring in damp forests alongside rivers at low altitude (40-1,600 m). It is morphologically similar to ''[[Restrepia]]'', but differs in lacking hairlike attachments on a mobile [[labellum|lip]] and having four [[pollinium|pollinia]] instead of two. The epithet ''ophiocephala'' is derived from the [[Greek language|Greek]] words ''ophis'' (snake) and ''cephalos''' (head). It grows from a short, creeping [[rhizome]] as a tufted, robust [[epiphyte]] to a length between 8 and 35 cm. The stout, cylindrical [[Plant stem|stem]] is erect and about 15 cm long and has a tubular bract. The fleshy, oblanceolate [[Leaf|leaves]] are 8 to 18 cm long and have a short petiole. The tiny single [[flower]]s have a length of about 2 cm. They grow from the base of the leaves, one at a time, on up to four clustered [[inflorescence]]s. They have a pale yellowish-brown color, dotted with dull purple spots. The outer surface is downy. The obovate, dorsal [[sepal]] is erect, while the lateral sepals are fused ([[synsepal]]s) with a small split at their apex. The elliptic [[petal]]s are much shorter and with ciliated margins. The fleshy [[labellum|lip]] is tongue-shaped. The flowers are in bloom from winter to spring and are strongly scented. ==References== *Luer, C.A.
